intro: Calyptromyrcia puberula, commonly known as the hairy calyptromyrcia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and understudied species.
